events.message: The applicant submitted a personal loan request to cover medical expenses and consolidate existing debt.
The loan application was categorised under Personal Loan based on described purpose including medical and debt reasons.
A loan officer was assigned to the case to initiate the review process and assist the applicant with further steps.
The initial review focused on validating the applicant’s stated purpose for the personal loan and assessing basic eligibility.
The loan officer requested detailed medical bills, debt statements, and proof of income for further verification.
Applicant submitted all requested documents including medical expense receipts, credit card statements, and salary slips.
A credit report was retrieved and evaluated, showing a stable credit history with a few past delayed payments.
Risk assessment considered applicant’s income, debts, and credit report, generating a moderate risk profile.
A loan offer was presented with terms specifying a 5-year repayment plan and a fixed interest rate tailored to the risk assessment.
The applicant responded positively to the loan offer and expressed willingness to proceed with the provided terms.
The application was escalated to the senior loan committee for final approval due to the loan amount exceeding typical limits.
The senior loan committee approved the personal loan application based on comprehensive document checks and risk evaluation.
The loan amount was disbursed to the applicant’s bank account for payment of outstanding medical bills and debt settlement.
Follow-up was conducted to ensure the applicant received the funds and is clear on repayment schedule and obligations.
The loan application process was successfully closed after confirming all final steps and delivering necessary documentation.
